intro: Medinilla mearnsii, commonly known as the velvet tangerine. It is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia, characterized by its glossy, waxy leaves and clusters of fragrant, pinkish-white flowers. The plant belongs to the Myristicaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in warm, humid climates and prefers partial shade. Its unique appearance and pleasant fragrance make it a popular choice for tropical gardens.
